page.title: 14A GRETTON CHURCHWARDEN
page.content: Alan Wheeler is a Churchwarden at the Gretton Parish Church. He was asked during an interview to give an account of the way he spends a typical Sunday. He said that before morning service in Church, it is his duty to get out the hymn books, light the candles, put up the hymn numbers, check the heating if required and switch on the lights. When the people begin to arrive, Alan welcomes them at the door. It is also his duty to take the collection, count it after the service, record it and lock it away in the safe. The heating and lights are then switched off. On his way home Alan collects his Sunday paper. During the afternoon his activities can include cleaning the car,cutting the lawn, gardening or going out with his wife and two sons. After tea he possibly has to attend another service.
